stories.title: The Inspiring Feats of Charles Steinmetz, the “Engineer’s Engineer”

stories.text:
Hi,

Are there real world jobs for experienced software/infra engineers in the astronomy/astrophysics field that pay correctly in France / Europe?

Anybody have experience on what kind of background in education is required for landing that kind of job?

I've been interested in that field since young and even took some actual post graduate introductory classes (Astro 101). I'm looking for a job that produces actual scientific value rather than just rat-racing along my coworkers.

Thanks to anybody that cares to chime in
stories.title: Ask HN: Are there jobs in Astronomy/Astrophysics for SWE?

stories.text: If so, what has your experience been like?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you use React Native in Production?

stories.text:
https://app.diagrams.net/?splash=0&ui=sketch

(The full URL can't seem to be saved in the dedicated URL field and so just adding it here)

I just tried the Sketch UI of Diagrams.net and found it very well done and easy to use.

I was surprised that it didn't seem to be featured more prominently on the Diagrams.net webpage. It seems great for lots of uses cases like planning, drafting, etc.. or even outlining/mind-mapping.

I discovered it via a Hacker News comment and so thought to share and also curious to hear your impressions on it? To me, it feels like a very elegant interface to use; there is minimal visual clutter, no menu, just the tools (rectangle, square, etc..). The controls are intuitive (can easily create shapes, add text, resize and add connections).
stories.title: Whiteboard Feature of Diagrams.net

stories.text:
Websockets are a total pain, are there any services that host websockets and integrate them into a regular REST app?

eg: - client messages get posted to a webhook - call their api to send a message to one or more sockets
stories.title: Ask HN: Any WebSockets-as-a-service offerings for REST integration?
